content:
The box 'fgrehm/trusty64-lxc' could not be found or
could not be accessed in the remote catalog. If this is a private
box on HashiCorp's Atlas, please verify you're logged in via
vagrant login. Also, please double-check the name. The expanded
URL and error message are shown below:

URL: ["https://atlas.hashicorp.com/fgrehm/trusty64-lxc"]
Error: error setting certificate verify locations:
CAfile: /etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt
CApath: none
I am getting the above error while setting up the environment

@Zoya Khan interesting! Can you try just accessing the URL in that error?
It looks like the problem is likely that there is something wrong with the SSL configuration on your machine, causing it to be unable to verify HTTPS content properly.
@Tim Abbott I will try to figure this out
I am unable to find any insights about this error! Can anyone please help me out

Hi @Zoya Khan - sorry you're having trouble. Just to double-check: what version of Ubuntu are you using? (I presume you're on Ubuntu because you posted in the on Ubuntu topic.) And what step of the environment setup were you doing when you got this error?
Hi @Sumana Harihareswara Sorry for the extremely late reply, I'm on Ubuntu 15.10.

@Zoya Khan I woudl personally suggest that you upgrade to ubuntu 16 and install on it ! Windows has many trivial and soon I would like to discuss with @Sumana Harihareswara about how can I suggest the '''way arounds''' I configured to get the dev-env up(still in process) !
Hi @Diptanshu Jamgade -- I'm not quite clear on what you're asking. Can you phrase it a different way, and maybe that will help me?

@Sumana Harihareswara I am trying the installation and there are few generic errors that often happen in the provisioning on vagrant box on windows(Cygwin). I am working on such a list of generic errors that we might be able to quote in our documentation or some other place so that people with windows OS can also start contributing without much problem of provisioning. This amendment of documentation can be considered to be temporary in the situation that once our provisioning runs successfully we remove away these amendments. Also, this would help all the developers focus on other bugs rather than basic provisioning bugs. This is what I wanted to propose !

Thanks for the explanation @Diptanshu Jamgade -- I understand now! Do you think it would be ok to simply add these as sections within https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-env-first-time-contributors.html#troubleshooting-common-errors ? And then we would remove those sections once we fix the provisioning problems.
I like your idea of listing the frequently-found problems within our installation documentation

@Sumana Harihareswara Am really glad you liked my idea. Could we start working in this direction as am almost done with my first task as per the discussion https://zulip.tabbott.net/#narrow/near/30974/stream/installation.20help/topic/vagrant . And also, https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-env-first-time-contributors.html#troubleshooting-common-errors this can be used. Can we mention special "troubleshooting and common errors for windows" section ?
need that badly. facing a lot of issues setting up the environment on windows with vagrant
@Diptanshu Jamgade I think you put up some rough notes somewhere, right? Do you have a link?

@Sumana Harihareswara Sorry but as of now I just have a roughly scribbled notes. I will be there at the earliest.
@Minerva Panda Could you please continue posting your doubts and errors in windows thread. I already have started that thread in context to windows-dev-env . Also, I have some discussions with other developers in that thread. So we get a cumulative chat. Moreoever, @Minerva Panda don't get bogged up. Take it slow and easy . We will get it through ! cheers !
@Zoya Khan hope things are going better?
